import React,{useEffect,useState}from'react';import{motion}from'framer-motion';import'./ProblemStatement.css';import{jsx as _jsx,jsxs as _jsxs}from"react/jsx-runtime";const ProblemStatement=()=>{const[isSticky,setIsSticky]=useState(false);const[visibleBoxes,setVisibleBoxes]=useState(0);useEffect(()=>{const handleScroll=()=>{const currentScrollY=window.scrollY;const solutionSection=document.querySelector('.sticky-solution-section');if(solutionSection){const rect=solutionSection.getBoundingClientRect();const sectionTopPosition=currentScrollY+rect.top;// Check if section should be sticky
const shouldBeSticky=currentScrollY>=sectionTopPosition;setIsSticky(shouldBeSticky);if(shouldBeSticky){// Calculate which boxes should be visible based on scroll progress
const scrollProgress=currentScrollY-sectionTopPosition;const boxRevealDistance=350;// Distance to scroll for each box
if(scrollProgress<boxRevealDistance){setVisibleBoxes(1);}else if(scrollProgress<boxRevealDistance*2){setVisibleBoxes(2);}else if(scrollProgress<boxRevealDistance*3){setVisibleBoxes(3);}else if(scrollProgress<boxRevealDistance*4){setVisibleBoxes(4);}else if(scrollProgress<boxRevealDistance*5){// Keep all boxes visible for a while
setVisibleBoxes(4);}else{// Release sticky after all boxes are shown and user scrolled more
setIsSticky(false);}}else{setVisibleBoxes(0);}}};window.addEventListener('scroll',handleScroll);handleScroll();// Initial call
